content:
Please execute the following task in my repository mcpmark-eval-zl/missing-semester:

Assign assignees for each open issue and open PR by adding labels instead of using direct assignees. Only contributors who appeared in the past 100 commits are considered. First, collect all such contributors and identify the most frequent author among them. For each open issue or PR, assign using labels according to the following rules:
	•	If the comments mention an author with @username, add a label in the format assigned-username.
	•	If multiple authors are mentioned, add labels in the same format for all of them.
	•	If no authors are mentioned in the comments, add a label for the most frequent contributor from the past 100 commits, using the format assigned-username.

Note: Based on your understanding, solve the task all at once by yourself, don't ask for my opinions on anything.

content.text:
Perfect! Now I have the actions I need. Let me start by implementing the solution step by step:

1. First, I'll get the repository commits to identify contributors from the past 100 commits
2. Find the most frequent contributor
3. Get all open issues and pull requests
4. For each issue/PR, check comments for @mentions
5. Add appropriate labels based on the rules

Let me start by getting the recent commits:

On macOS Chrome eats up ridiculous amounts of RAM whereas Safari is noticeably more efficient. \\\\r\\\\n\\\\r\\\\nRegarding privacy, both support uBlock Origin which does most of the heavy lifting and both lack neater features like Multi-Account Containers. Chrome also has a track record of not respecting privacy when it comes to Google sites [source](https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=24817304).\\\\r\\\\n\\\\r\\\\nI also like Safari's compatibility. Whenever a website is giving me trouble because of my browser setup in Firefox, I'll use Safari and it works 100% of time.\\\\r\\\\n\\\\r\\\\nTL;DR: If I had to stop using Firefox, I'll probably use Safari as my default\\\",\\\"user\\\":{\\\"login\\\":\\\"LLiuZheng\\\"}},{\\\"body\\\":\\\"*Original author: @anishathalye*\\\\n\\\\nWe currently say:\\\\r\\\\n\\\\r\\\\n> Should you want an alternative, Firefox is our recommendation.\\\\r\\\\n\\\\r\\\\nShould we switch to clearly stating that Firefox is our recommended browser, and de-emphasize Chrome / mention any privacy problems with it? I personally use Firefox, Jose does too, and iirc Jon does as well?\\\\r\\\\n\\\\r\\\\nIt might also be worth mentioning Chromium, the slightly de-Google'd version of Chrome (though it's missing things like automatic updates). I currently use Chromium on the rare occasion where a site that I need to use does not work properly in Firefox.\\\\r\\\\n\\\\r\\\\nAlso, like @AustinConlon suggested, maybe we could say a bit more about Safari being a privacy-respecting browser. 4. **PR #21** - "add SSH ProxyCommand/ProxyJump advice"

5. **Issue #15** - "Swift Playgrounds in the notebook programming section?"

   - **Reason:** No comments, so assigned to most frequent contributor

6. **Issue #14** - "Safari in Q&A"

   - **Reason:** Comments mention @jonhoo, @JJGO, @anishathalye, and @mahmud2011

7. **Issue #9** - "Add common network/DNS tools to debugging?"
   - **Labels added:** `assigned-jonhoo`, `assigned-JJGO`, `assigned-anishathalye`, `assigned-flindeberg`
   - **Reason:** Comments mention @jonhoo, @JJGO, @anishathalye, and @flindeberg

All labels follow the format `assigned-username` as requested, and the assignment logic correctly prioritized @mentions in comments over the default assignment to the most frequent contributor.
